timeline.message: Security enhancement implementation of the Keycloak adapter for OpenID Connect support.

Added SSO on guest pages which uses a public client to check if already logged in.
   Added public client option for cases where we may be using a public client and confidential client.
   Added required scripts for SSO check
Added getSecurityProvider function so that we can get the provider and potentially do special logic.
Update override variables so that they can come from environment variables.

Updated login redirect
   Added requestCache - taken from ShibbolethPreAuthFilter
   Updated to use querystring (redirectUrl) value if it exists.
   If not then default to context root.

Added public-client option to keycloak json so that it is configurable.
Added autologin logic and make it the default.
Updated keycloak configuration to support autologin - had to add special filter to do the redirect if not logged in.
Fixed bug with missing client id - it would occur when using confidential client and no public client.

Changed default to autologin
Removed hard coded /signin and base it on the pathinfo from the LoginUrlAuthenticationEntryPoint configuration.
Change logoutSuccessUrl to use context root instead of hard coded /geonetwork

Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/geonetwork/core-geonetwork into add_keycloak_support

# Conflicts:
#	web/src/main/webapp/WEB-INF/config-security/config-security.xml
Apply changes required for client back channel logout via admin url

Removed isSSO function as we really only need to know the type of form for the login
Also added missing HttpSessionEventPublisher.java

Forgot to commit this change as part of the removal of issso in recent commits.
This fixes bug with logintype=link not working.
Add IDP logout parameter so that it is possible to do a front channel logout to the IDP.

timeline.bodyText: Should be used StringUtils.isEmpty or just need to check for null?
timeline.author: josegar74

replies.bodyText:
It is used for caching.
public static String signinPath = null; 
It checks to see if signinPath still contains the initial value and if so then sets the values based on configuration values from config-security.properties.
loginForm=/signin?node=@@nodeId@@
Subsequent calls should just return the value.
The intent was to use existing configuration values instead of hardcoding the value to "/signin"  But I did noticed that there are some hard coded values of "/signin" elsewhere in the code(mostly in Angular) so I'm not sure how easy it would be to change this property anyway

replies.bodyText:
I updated the comments to make it more clear as to why this was required.
It is mostly because the WebApplicationContextUtils.getWebApplicationContext(servletContext) returns null and it was causing NPE.  It seems like the the application is not registered as a WebApplicationContext so I had to modify the code to use ApplicationContextHolder.get() and this fixed the issue.
Maybe in the future if the application is registered correctly as a WebApplicationContext then this file can be removed.
Is this correction OK - or should there be a fix to register the application correctly as a WebApplicationContext?

+/* Maven dependencies 4.8.3 seems to contains bugs related to the admin url.
+ * It was preventing the Admin URL client backchannel logout from working.
+ * Issues is explained in the following https://issues.redhat.com/browse/KEYCLOAK-10266 and seems to be fixed in version 8 or greater
+ * If upgrading maven dependency to 8 or greater then it should be possible to update spring security configuration
+ * to use org.keycloak.adapters.springsecurity.management.HttpSessionManager and remove this version.
+ * At the time of writing this code, the goal was to target usage of RedHat SSO version 7.3 which was based on keycloak 4.8.20
+ * https://access.redhat.com/articles/2342881.  It is unclear if newer client drivers are supported with this version.
+ */
 
 package org.fao.geonet.kernel.security.keycloak;

timeline.bodyText: Just to check this file is required?
timeline.author: josegar74

replies.bodyText:
I updated the documentation to provide more details as to why this was required. It also references the bug that describes the issue.
This is required because our code was based on 4.8.3 which is the version that RedHat SSO 7.3 uses. This is our target software at the moment.  It was noticed that RedHat SSO has released a newer version that now uses the newer drivers.
Our intention is to upgrade to the newer version of the software in the new year.  At that time I will create a PR to upgrade to newer version of the keycloak adapter and I can will be able to remove this file.
replies.author: ianwallen

replies.bodyText:
It was mostly used for Shibboleth for the SSO parameters.  For all cases it would check for the existence of the bean and if the bean was not found then then it continued processing as it did before.  So unless LDAP or CAS was using Shibboleth configuration options, they should not be affected by these changes.
Once this PR is approved then it would probably be a good idea if LDAP or CAS also used this class if there is a need to support common configurations for SSO.
